title: Materials Project Training
body:
Hello, I want to eventually train SchNet models on some crystal structures that I have obtained using Quantum ESPRESSO, and I figured I would first test out my model settings on the Materials Project database. While training the formation energy per atom, the MAE seems to plateau at 0.6 eV/atom, which is quite a bit worse than the 0.041 eV/atom that I see in the SchNetPack paper: https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jctc.8b00908 I have the code I used to construct the model below. Are the settings I used reasonable and similar for the ones used in the benchmark, or is there something I'm missing? 
```
mp = MaterialsProject("./mp.db", load_only=[MaterialsProject.EformationPerAtom], environment_provider=sch.environment.AseEnvironmentProvider(5))

train, val, test = spk.train_test_split(
        data=mp,
        num_train=int(4/5*len(mp)),
        num_val=int(1/5*len(mp)),
        split_file="split.npz"
    )

train_loader = spk.AtomsLoader(train, batch_size=16, shuffle=True)
val_loader = spk.AtomsLoader(val, batch_size=16)

schnet = spk.representation.SchNet(
    n_atom_basis=128,
    n_filters=128,
    n_gaussians=30,
    n_interactions=6,
    cutoff=5., cutoff_network=spk.nn.cutoff.CosineCutoff
)

output = spk.atomistic.Atomwise(n_in=128, property=MaterialsProject.EformationPerAtom)
model = spk.AtomisticModel(representation=schnet, output_modules=output)
optimizer = Adam(model.parameters(), lr=0.0001)

loss = trn.build_mse_loss([MaterialsProject.EformationPerAtom])

metrics = [spk.metrics.MeanAbsoluteError(MaterialsProject.EformationPerAtom)]

hooks = [
    trn.CSVHook(log_path='./', metrics=metrics),
        trn.ReduceLROnPlateauHook(
        optimizer,
        patience=5, factor=0.8, min_lr=1e-6,
        stop_after_min=True
    )
]

trainer = trn.Trainer(
    model_path='./',
    model=model,
    hooks=hooks,
    loss_fn=loss,
    optimizer=optimizer,
    train_loader=train_loader,
    validation_loader=val_loader,
)
```
